New Records: This is the biggest-ever win for a team during a Euro opener.
Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz struck the opening goal 10 minutes in.
Jamal Musiala doubled Germany's lead with an emphatic finish.
Ryan Porteous was sent off for a two-footed challenge on Ilkay Gundogan.
Kai Havertz tucked away the resulting penalty.
Niclas Füllkrug powered in a fourth goal midway through the second half.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal late in the match.
Emre Can added a fifth goal with the final kick of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann had spoken of his players' hunger to atone for the failures of recent times.
Steve Clarke urged Scotland to 'fear no one' going into the country's second straight Euros.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany's strong statement of intent after three successive failures at major tournaments.
Toni Kroos will hang up his boots for good after the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany's first men's major tournament as hosts since the 2006 World Cup.
Scotland must regroup quickly with games to come in Group A against Switzerland and Hungary.
